data.title: Can't close a file without saving without mouse
data.body:
I can't seem to find a way to force close a file with changes without having to click on the _"Don't save"_ button with my mouse. There's no command to bind a keyboard shortcut to nor is there an accelerator/alt key in the dialog (I'm attaching a screenshot).

This is a bit annoying, maybe I'm doing something wrong?

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1 f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519
- OS Version: Arch Linux

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make changes in a file
2. Try to close the file without saving

![screenshot_20170321_150753](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/424891/24151445/11e0f1f4-0e49-11e7-853b-21d82e2858e7.png)

data.title: backups: stop lowercasing file paths (fixes #16591)
data.body:
This PR changes hot exit to no longer lowercase the file paths on Windows and macOS. This fixes a data loss issue that can be reproduced via:
* open a file and make changes
* copy the path of the file and use quick open to open this path, but change the file name to upper case
* make changes to both files without saving
* restart

=> the changes of one buffer are lost

This fix restores both buffers to where they were before exit.

Also fixes https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16591

data.title: vscode Complex Commands
Windows : Opens in wrong RDP Session

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 2012 R2 Server

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Connect to server using RDP as Administrator (Session 1)
2. Open VS Code
3. Have another person connect to server using RDP as Administrator (Session 2)

If the user in Session 2 tries to open VS Code it creates a new window in Session 1. likewise if they double click an associated file it opens in VS Code in Session 1.

data.title: Feature request: Allow terminating tasks running in the integrated terminal
data.body:
When using the integrated terminal with the task runner, if you try to start the task while it is already running you get an warning saying 
"There is an active running task right now. Terminate it first before executing another task."

If you then try and terminate the task, you get an info saying 
"The tasks are executed in the integrated terminal. Use the terminal to manage the tasks."

Is it possible to send a signal to the task in the integrated terminal to kill it?

I can manually press Ctrl+C in the terminal to stop it - it would be nice if it could send a signal instead.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the attached TSV, Search for \t and press alt+enter ([test2.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/857792/test2.txt))
2. Press left arrow to remove selection and enter cursor mode (Replace mode here works very weird)

data.title: License question - can a corporate IT package for internal deployment
data.body:
License point 5 from https://code.visualstudio.com/license states:
"You may not.. share, publish, or lend the software, or provide it as a hosted solution for others to use, or transfer the software or this agreement to any third party."

The company I work for requests software is packaged for internal deployment, and made available via their application portal.  Does the license term above prohibit this?

data.title: node and node2 should support evaluateName field
data.body:
Currently VSCode uses this [ugly heuristic](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/debug/common/debugModel.ts#L280) to get the parent chain of a variable. We need to get rid of this heuristic since VSCode should be language agnostic and we already have a [field in our protocol](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/debug/common/debugProtocol.d.ts#L1168) that represents this.

I suggest that node and node2 start supporting this. Once we have that we can notify other debug adapter writers about this field with the goal of droping this heuristic in April.

An example where this field is used: adding a variable from the variables view to a watch list or copying a variable value to the clipboard(we first evaluate it using the parent chain)

data.title: Some keys don't work sometimes in the SCM viewlet's input box.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11-insider
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:

Sometimes, when I'm typing a commit message, some keys such as <kbd>Space</kbd> don't work at all in the viewlet, whereas the work in other apps and even other editor panes in vscode. The bug happens intermittently, and probably when I alt-tab directly to SCM view in vscode from some other app. This is the case from the day the vscode changed GIT to SCM. Didn't report the issue due to utter laziness on my behalf.

Lately, I figured out a way to beat the bug. It seems like the focus is set to the `diff list` below the textarea, but when I type letters, they get typed in the commit message box. But when I type space, it doesn't work. So, I try to reset the focus by pressing <kbd>Tab</kbd> or <kbd>Shift-Tab</kbd>, and space starts working again.

data.title: The new diff-viewer locks up when commit is in progress
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11-insider
- OS Version: Win10

Before the move to the new "SCM", when a commit was in progress, I could still view the diffs of other (unstaged) files. Now, it just shows a `Loading` state, and the diffs are only visible after the commit is done.

data.title: Duplicate Identifier typescript compiled js in split screen.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: **1.10.2**
- OS Version : **Microsoft Windows [Version 6.1.7601]**

This error happens only on **not exported** namespaces.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. click on any **compiled .js** file.
2. click on **split editor** //opens .js file in splitted screen
3. click on the **.ts file of the compiled .js** //opens new tab in splitted view.

**.js file -> split editor -> .ts file**

**Result:**

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22618943/24139459/6dd56116-0e1c-11e7-996b-207dad3fa187.png)


**Steps again,**
**Open js file:**

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22618943/24139484/89f142de-0e1c-11e7-87bd-249ba6446f5d.png)

**Then split screen:**

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22618943/24139505/9c0adc0a-0e1c-11e7-960d-a6ab65e1e6ff.png)

**Open ts file:**

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22618943/24139528/ad18f8ce-0e1c-11e7-9b69-6d508cbfeb99.png)

**error will show up in every file...**

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22618943/24139839/fe3d3f48-0e1d-11e7-9441-989726c577f2.png)

...until i reopen the ts file, save it and reopen all affected files. Then everything works just fine.

I´m not sure if this error depends on the same problem, but when i close all files and open only a ts file which is using a namespace from the "source.ts", i get an error...:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22618943/24140022/c9b1ee3a-0e1e-11e7-9794-b322c631b914.png)

**...until i open the "source.ts" file:**

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22618943/24140055/eecab1c0-0e1e-11e7-8a5d-7c992c03a382.png)

data.title: The default keybindings for "blockComment" on Ubuntu are wrong.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

On _Windows_, use **shift+alt+a** to add block comments; on _linux_, it's said to be same, [official doc here](https://code.visualstudio.com/shortcuts/keyboard-shortcuts-linux.pdf), but in fact, the settings in keybinding.json is **ctrl+shirt+a**, hope this can be fixed in the next release.

data.title: [BUG] 'editor.emmet.action.balanceInward' expand selection instead of shrinking
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Win 10 Pro x64 french

## Steps to Reproduce:

1. edit a Html file properly tagged
2. run `editor.emmet.action.balanceOutward` multiple times
3. run `editor.emmet.action.balanceInward ` multiple times

## Results

`editor.emmet.action.balanceInward ` does the same thing as  `editor.emmet.action.balanceOutward` , it expands selection.

## Expectation

Please see this [live example](https://docs.emmet.io/actions/match-pair/).

data.title: [themes] Uninstall/Exclude from list the built-in color themes

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hi,

Currently _Code_ comes with some built-in color themes. It would be nice if users could just disable/exclude some of them or all of them from the list. So this list could only contain the themes the users really use.
